titleInfo.title: Postcard photograph of Carl Everett Johnson and Genie More, ca. 1910

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Original black and white postcard photograph of (left to right) Carl Evertt Johnson and Genie More, dressed in overcoats and hats. They are seated in front of a seascape background with nautical props. Carl is holding a cigar in his right hand. Both men have one hand that is ungloved and holding the glove in the ungloved hand. The photograph appears to be a photograph that was made into a postcard, and the space at the bottom suggests it is a copy of the original. Carl Everett Johnson is the son of Dora Corinne Adams Johnson.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
